name: KPMG
title: Software Engineer Intern
summary: Led multifaceted initiatives including the development of efficient file comparison software, innovative PDF algorithms, proactive security measures, comprehensive testing frameworks, and performance-enhancing microservices, fostering a culture of knowledge-sharing and transparency within the company.
work: ● Led and delivered a file comparison software (Python) surpassing Adobe's with 48% more accuracy and 60% faster processing.
● Led 95% of app security bug reduction by enforcing secure coding practices and upgrading Python with 100+ dependencies.
● Achieved 30-50% faster audit processing by implementing a distributed cache service (Python), boosting auditor efficiency.
● Enhanced financial auditing accuracy by 35% using patented Python algorithms, optimizing PDF data extraction.
● Tested 1000+ REST API endpoints by developing a Clojure-based property testing framework under tight deadlines.
● Streamlined Azure deployments with systematic CI/CD pipelines, Kubernetes configurations, and refined SDLC measures.
● Improved divisional transparency by hosting 20+ company-wide knowledge-sharing sessions, engaging over 70% of staff.
technologies: Django, Python, Clojure, Automated Testing, Algorithms, Kubernetes, Docker, Microservices, KEDA, Distrubuted Systems

name: Rutgers, Shumyatsky Lab
title: Research Assistant
summary: Led the creation of a Python, OpenCV, and Arduino-based software platform facilitating Optogenetics experiments, enhancing automation, and improving efficiency for researchers with non-technical backgrounds.
work: ● Reduced Optogenetics experiment time by 83% through developing Python software to automate the experimental process.
● Automated 60+ hours of video analysis by implementing machine learning pipelines using DeepLabCut and EzTrack.
● Achieved a 93% cost reduction by creating an in-house Arduino-based device to replace the existing TTL pulse generator.
technologies: Python, OpenCV, Arduino, Statistical Data Analysis

name: Whiz.ai
title: Software Engineer Intern
location: New Jersey, USA and Pune, India
summary: Enhanced API efficiency and reduced database latency by implementing Python-based back-end optimizations, intermediate caching, Alembic integration, and global support for machine learning engineers in an agile environment.
work: ● Optimized back-end functionality (Python, Flask) to support language models resulting in a 30% decrease in API latency.
● Developed and onboarded the entire team to utilize Python tool for streamlined database migrations with Alembic API.
technologies: Python, Databases, Flask, REST APIs, Language Models, Microservices

name: HealCo Inc.
title: Full Stack Engineer Intern
summary: Architected and deployed HealCo's feature-rich press release web app, orchestrated a scalable DevOps system, executed a codebase migration to TypeScript, and integrated Stripe for payment functionality.
work: ● Architected, developed, and deployed HealCo’s press release web app with robust identity access management, press sharing functionality, and administrative features using NextJS, TypeScript, PostgreSQL, Twilio, SendGrid, and Stripe.
● Built a production-grade, scalable, and cost-effective DevOps system and CI/CD pipeline for all HealCo apps using AWS, Docker, and GitLab CI/CD.
● Migrated the entire codebase from JavaScript to TypeScript to reduce bugs and improve maintainability.
● Rapidly created and deployed web application features for hospitals to lease medical spaces during the COVID-19 pandemic.
● Integrated Stripe into the web application to enable payments by ACH debits and credit cards.
technologies: AWS, Node.js, Next.js, React.js, Typescript, Javascript, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Docker, Microservices

name: Ziplyne Inc.
title: Software Engineer Intern
summary: Played a pivotal role in overhauling the company's digital presence, integrating third-party tools, and enhancing product visibility to drive sales analytics for Ziplyne.
work: ● Collaborated with the CEO, CMO, UI/UX designers, and senior developers to assist in the company redesign.
● Rebuilt the company website with third party webhook integrations and also worked on designing parts of the main product using React.js.
● Used 3rd party snippets and API integrations to improve web functionality and increase product visibility which aided the Ziplyne team with sales analytics.

name: Quakerbridge Hacks
title: Founder and President
summary: Founded and led the 12-Hour Hackathon in Trenton, NJ, taking charge of all aspects of event planning, including marketing, finance, logistics, sponsorship, and venue coordination.
work: ● President and Founder of 12-Hour Hackathon in Trenton, NJ
● Oversaw all aspects of event planning, demonstrating strong leadership principles in marketing, finance, logistics, sponsorship, and venue coordination.
